result.execSummary:
The defendant John Odom Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time (Jail).

Court Orders the balance of the sentence be Huber with standard release conditions.
Starting 06-15-2015

miscConds.notes:
Costs and Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $75.00 per month starting 11-01-2014; alternate  90 hours of Community Service.  Court must receive notice of completion Prior to 09-18-2016.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment within 45 days.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Be involved in AA/NA and obtain a sponsor.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Obtain a valid license within the First 6 months.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
